title.narrative: URG project: "Supporting journalist engagement at the Human Rights Council: improving transparency, visibility and public accountability" 2019-2021

description.narrative: Build the capacity (knowledge, expertise and skills) of media professionals/journalists from developing countries, as key human rights defenders in their countries and regions; and Increase awareness and knowledge of, and interest in, the Human Rights Council and its work among rights-holders around the world, thereby improving transparency, visibility and public accountability

title.narrative: Increase in accurate, quality reporting on the work/output of the Human Rights Council in the target countries (especially in Africa), and increase in reporting that links debates and decisions in Geneva with national-level policy debates and changes on t

By the end of the project, media professionals around the world, especially in developing countries, will have a clearer, more detailed and more nuanced understanding about the Council, its work, its importance and its relevance to individual people on the ground. Moreover, journalists will act as amplifiers, via their articles and broadcasts, promoting such interest and understanding among the general public and civil society.
